description:
In this new action-comedy, everything about a young man named Saitama screams "AVERAGE,” from his lifeless expression, to his bald head, to his unimpressive physique. However, this average-looking fellow doesn't have your average problem... He's actually a superhero that's looking for tough opponents! The problem is, every time he finds a promising candidate he beats the snot out of them in one punch. Can Saitama finally find an evil villain strong enough to challenge him? Follow Saitama through his hilarious romps as he searches for new bad guys to challenge!

(Source: Viz Media)

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEBU_KURO)

He was once the assistant and apprentice of Takeshi Obata of _Hikaru no Go_ and _Death Note_ fame. He had a number of one-shots published in Weekly Shonen Jump, namely _Partner_ (won the 122nd Hop*Step award), _Samui Hanashi_ (won the 2nd Prize in the 51st Akatsuka Award), _Kaitou COLT_, and of course, _Eyeshield 21_ (began serialization in Weekly Shonen Jump No. 34 2002).

He is also responsible for designing Dust Man from _Rockman 4_ and Crystal Man from _Rockman 5_.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ONE_rakugaki)** | **[Website](http://galaxyheavyblow.web.fc2.com/)**

One (often stylized as ONE) is a manga artist, best known as the author and creator of [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/manga/85364/One-Punch-Man/) and [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/manga/85189/Mob-Psycho-100/).

He grew up in Konosu, Saitama, and started getting interested in manga when his parents bought him [Crayon Shin-chan](https://anilist.co/manga/32435/Crayon-Shinchan/). ONE also made several manga in the past that never got serialized such as "Sun Man" and "Tennis Player Ryu".

ONE started releasing One-Punch Man on his own website under no official publisher. [A web version](https://anilist.co/manga/74347/One-PunchMan/) was later serialized by Weekly Young Jump with [Yusuke Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/96903/Yusuke-Murata) as the artist. Mob Psycho 100 was serialized in Ura Sunday, the online version of Weekly Shonen Sunday.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pawel_dybala)
Besides translation, he also does lectures and research at the Jagiellonian University in Kraków. Works with publishers J.P.Fantastica and Egmont Poland.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jun_emu_)

Longtime member of [Yuusuke Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/96903)'s staff. Specializes in effects.

Ōkuma Hakko is the editor of the manga series Golden Kamuy by Noda Satoru, published by Shueisha. Since joining Shueisha in 2008, he has worked in the editorial department of Weekly Young Jump. Okuma was involved in the launch of the ground breaking manga website ‘Tonari no Young Jump’. He is the editor of numerous best-selling manga including the immensely popular One Punch-Man, Himouto! Umaru-chan, Uratarou, Mononogatari, and Akebi-Chan no sailor-fuku.
